content:
Absolutely! Here are a few classic rock songs from the 1980s that maintain the original sound of their respective bands:

1. "Back in Black" by AC/DC (1980) - This song is one of AC/DC's most iconic hits, featuring a signature guitar riff and powerful vocals from lead singer Brian Johnson.

2. "Another Brick in the Wall (Part 2)" by Pink Floyd (1980) - This song retains the progressive rock sound and social commentary that Pink Floyd was known for, with a memorable guitar solo and powerful vocals.

3. "Urgent" by Foreigner (1981) - This song features the classic rock sound that Foreigner was known for, with a driving guitar riff and catchy chorus.

4. "Pour Some Sugar on Me" by Def Leppard (1987) - This song is a staple of 80s rock, with a heavy guitar riff, pounding drums, and a sing-along chorus.

5. "Jumpin' Jack Flash" by The Rolling Stones (1986) - This cover of the Stones' classic hit retains the bluesy sound and Jagger's signature vocals, with some updated production to fit the 80s sound.

Each of these songs maintain the classic sound of their respective bands, while still fitting into the musical landscape of the 1980s. Hopefully, one of these songs will be more your style!
